snippet.title: Aust terror plots foiled since 2014
snippet.content:
TERROR PLOTS THWARTED IN AUSTRALIA SINCE 2014: 2017 * July 29 - Four men arrested in Sydney accused of plotting to bring down an aircraft. 2016 * Dec 23 - Counter-terror raids in Melbourne, three men arrested for planning to bomb major Melbourne landmarks. * Oct 12 - Two Sydney teenagers arrested after allegedly buying bayonet-style knives in Bankstown and planning IS-style attack. They remain in custody. * Aug 6 - Melbourne man arrested after allegedly plotting to bomb Melbourne's anarchist headquarters. Anti-Islam extremist Philip Galea remains in custody awaiting committal hearing.
Related Articles
* June 14 - Sydney teenager with Asperger's syndrome charged with terrorism offences after allegedly posting online threats. * May 17 - Tamim Khaja, 18, arrested for allegedly trying to obtain gun and scouting Sydney buildings to attack. Trial set to begin in October 2017. * April 24 - 16-year-old arrested in Sydney for planning to attack Anzac Day services, after allegedly trying to obtain gun and bomb-making materials. He later pleads guilty. * Jan 25 - 18-year-old man arrested in Sydney after allegedly found with terror-related documents. In July, 2017 Sameh Bayda and his wife Alo-Bridget Namoa are committed to stand trial on terror-related charges. 2015 * May 8 - 17-year-old boy arrested in Melbourne, accused of trying to source bomb-making materials. Sentenced to seven years jail, later increased to 11 years. * April 18 - Five men linked to slain attacker Numan Haider arrested in Melbourne for conspiring to attack police during Anzac Day services. Only one, Sevdet Besim, pleaded guilty and was sentenced to 10 years jail, increased on appeal to 14 years. * Feb 11 - Omar Al-Kutobi, 24, and Mohammad Kiad, 25, arrested allegedly hours away from carrying out attack on the public. Both jailed for at least 15 years. 2014 * Dec - Counter-terrorism raids uncover guns and ammunition in homes across Sydney. Five men and a teenager later plead guilty to terror-related charges for planning attacks on police headquarters and government buildings. Mohamed Almaouie, Farhad Said and Ibrahim Ghazzawy have already been sentenced while Jibryl Almaouie, Sulayman Khalid and the unnamed teenager are yet to be sentenced. * Sept 18 - 15 people arrested in Australia's largest terror raids in Sydney, but only one ultimately charged with plotting to kidnap and behead a random member of the public. Omarjan Azari remains in custody awaiting trial. (C) AAP 2017
